sentence.Network_en: These men look a bit drippy.

A drippy love scene ., 一个过于伤感的爱情场面.

list.abs: A drippy love scene ., 一个过于伤感的爱情场面.

entry.tran: (指人)愚蠢的,软弱的;(书、音乐等)无聊的，枯燥的,过于伤感的
entry.def: If you describe someone as drippy, you mean that they are rather stupid and weak. If you describe something such as a book or a type of music as drippy, you mean that you think it is rather stupid, dull, and sentimental.

example.ex: These men look a bit drippy.

auth_sentence.content: I thought the idea of a Medieval Romance sounded drippy.
auth_sentence.res_content: I thought the idea of a Medieval Romance sounded drippy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I thought the idea of a Medieval Romance sounded drippy.

auth_sentence.content: The day was overcast and drippy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The day was overcast and drippy.

auth_sentence.content: There is not one moment of the ballad-heavy, drippy, sugar-sweet overdose of Guilty that deserves even a second listen.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is not one moment of the ballad-heavy, drippy, sugar-sweet overdose of Guilty that deserves even a second listen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is not one moment of the ballad-heavy, drippy, sugar-sweet overdose of Guilty that deserves even a second listen.
